titleStmt.title: Thomas Rector et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9866

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your Petitioners Citizens of Jackson county Ky, Respectfully sheweth that at the Present term of the Jackson circuit court Web Hunter & Shelton Lane were found guilty under an Indictment In said county for unlawfull gameing at cards -- & fined $20 Each & cost they state that from the proff ^proof^ In the case & Law In regard to unlawfull gameing they were bound to find them but they are confident that they did not know that it was contrary to Law to play Said cards for the Small Sum of 10 cents & consequently no Intention to violate the Law was Intended, that Web Hunter & Shelton Lane are comparatively poor men & If they are Compeled to pay Said fines they will be seriously Injured that they are good citizens & ought to be Relieved from paying Said fines wherefore In view of the whole case they ask your Excellency to Remit said fines they Really think that the payment of the fees & cost in the case will be a sufficient punishment against said Hunter & Lane & Example made of them will be a Sufficient warning to others In the county to compell them to observe the Law In said cases= November the 13th 1860 --

Thomas Rector
H, D, Gentry
Owen France
James Morris
Samuel Combs
Alfred Evans
G,, W,, King
John Morris
Jas Wood
John Stephens S J C
Thos J Engle ck

Web Hunter & Shelton Lane
} Petition
To his Excellency B. Magoffin
Remitted
B. M
Jackson Cir. Ct
$20 each } Gaming
W. Hunter & S. Lane
Issd Jany 30. 1861
